# The `MemoryBuffer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory buffer. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MemoryBuffer</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This interface provides simple read-only access to a block of memory, and provides simple methods for reading files and standard input into a memory buffer.

In addition to basic access to the characters in the file, this interface guarantees you can read one character past the end of the file, and that this character will read as &#39;\\0&#39;.

The &#39;\\0&#39; guarantee is needed to support an optimization – it&#39;s intended to be more efficient for clients which are reading all the data to stop reading when they encounter a &#39;\\0&#39; than to continually check the file position to see if it has reached the end of the file.

Definition at line 51 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### dontNeedIfMmap() {#a84540ead6f0846d050a11c007f892f00}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::MemoryBuffer::dontNeedIfMmap ()"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
For read-only MemoryBuffer&#95;MMap, mark the buffer as unused in the near future and the kernel can free resources associated with it.

Further access is supported but may be expensive. This calls madvise(MADV&#95;DONTNEED) on read-only file mappings on &#42;NIX systems. This function should not be called on a writable buffer.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00083">83</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### getFile() {#aa98611beefe78f907beeee7305cc8174}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getFile (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename, bool IsText=false, bool RequiresNullTerminator=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>, bool IsVolatile=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> &gt; Alignment=std::nullopt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Open the specified file as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>, returning a new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> if successful, otherwise returning null.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="IsText">Set to true to indicate that the file should be read in text mode.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IsVolatile">Set to true to indicate that the contents of the file can change outside the user&#39;s control, e.g. when libclang tries to parse while the user is editing/updating the file or if the file is on an NFS.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">Set to indicate that the buffer should be aligned to at least the specified alignment.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp/#l00260">260</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp">MemoryBuffer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getFileAsStream() {#a76b193577aa67b1fac72cdbb5343241a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getFileAsStream (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Read all of the specified file into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> as a stream (i.e.

until EOF reached). This is useful for special files that look like a regular file but have 0 size (e.g. /proc/cpuinfo on Linux).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00106">106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp/#l00577">577</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp">MemoryBuffer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getMemBuffer() {#a0f68098734d6d3b451aacf5b38a67131}

Note that InputData must be null terminated if RequiresNullTerminator is true.

### getMemBufferCopy() {#a32d2c9ba9019e6e41605c60acd06bd09}

InputData does not have to be null terminated.

### getOpenFile() {#a0163ef693f4fd640ec72a5fe74e5852c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getOpenFile (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">sys::fs::file&#95;t</a> FD, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename, uint64&#95;t FileSize, bool RequiresNullTerminator=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>, bool IsVolatile=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> &gt; Alignment=std::nullopt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given an already-open file descriptor, read the file and return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="IsVolatile">Set to true to indicate that the contents of the file can change outside the user&#39;s control, e.g. when libclang tries to parse while the user is editing/updating the file or if the file is on an NFS.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">Set to indicate that the buffer should be aligned to at least the specified alignment.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00126">126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp/#l00550">550</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp">MemoryBuffer.cpp</a>.

### getOpenFileSlice() {#a4432e24dbd29bafd528e623c04c62395}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ErrorOr&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MemoryBuffer &gt; &gt; MemoryBuffer::getOpenFileSlice (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">sys::fs::file&#95;t</a> FD, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Filename, uint64&#95;t MapSize, int64&#95;t Offset, bool IsVolatile=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> &gt; Alignment=std::nullopt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Given an already-open file descriptor, map some slice of it into a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a>.

The slice is specified by an <code>Offset</code> and <code>MapSize</code>. Since this is in the middle of a file, the buffer is not null terminated.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/memorybuffer-h">MemoryBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp/#l00558">558</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/memorybuffer-cpp">MemoryBuffer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
